MemberSignature.Value: public static string? CommaEllipsize (string? text, Android.Text.TextPaint? p, float avail, string? oneMore, string? more);
.method public static hidebysig string CommaEllipsize(string text, class Android.Text.TextPaint p, float32 avail, string oneMore, string more) cil managed
static member CommaEllipsize : string * Android.Text.TextPaint * single * string * string -> string

Docs.param: the Paint with which to measure the text
the horizontal width available for the text (in pixels)
the string for "1 more" in the current locale
the string for "%d more" in the current locale
Docs.summary: Converts a CharSequence of the comma-separated form "Andy, Bob, Charles, David" that is too wide to fit into the specified width into one like "Andy, Bob, 2 more".

format.a: Java documentation for android.text.TextUtils.commaEllipsize(java.lang.CharSequence, android.text.TextPaint, float, java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Usage: Android.Text.TextUtils.CopySpansFrom (source, start, end, kind, dest, destoff)

Docs.summary: Copies the spans from the region start...end in source to the region destoff...destoff+end-start in dest.

format.a: Java documentation for android.text.TextUtils.copySpansFrom(android.text.Spanned, int, int, java.lang.Class, android.text.Spannable, int).

Docs.exception: if any of the copied spans are out of range in dest.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string? ExpandTemplate (string? template, params string[]? values);
.method public static hidebysig string ExpandTemplate(string template, string[] values) cil managed
static member ExpandTemplate : string * string[] -> string

Docs.param: the input text containing "^1"-style placeholder values. This object is not modified; a copy is returned.
CharSequences substituted into the template. The first is substituted for "^1", the second for "^2", and so on.
Docs.summary: Replace instances of "^1", "^2", etc.
Docs.returns: the new CharSequence produced by doing the replacement

MemberSignature.Value: public static Android.Text.CapitalizationMode GetCapsMode (Java.Lang.ICharSequence? cs, int off, Android.Text.CapitalizationMode reqModes);
.method public static hidebysig valuetype Android.Text.CapitalizationMode GetCapsMode(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence cs, int32 off, valuetype Android.Text.CapitalizationMode reqModes) cil managed
static member GetCapsMode : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * int * Android.Text.CapitalizationMode -> Android.Text.CapitalizationMode

Docs.param: The text that should be checked for caps modes.
Location in the text at which to check.
The modes to be checked: may be any combination of #CAP_MODE_CHARACTERS, #CAP_MODE_WORDS, and #CAP_MODE_SENTENCES.
Docs.summary: Determine what caps mode should be in effect at the current offset in the text.
Docs.returns: Returns the actual capitalization modes that can be in effect at the current position, which is any combination of #CAP_MODE_CHARACTERS, #CAP_MODE_WORDS, and #CAP_MODE_SENTENCES.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: the Locale for which we want the layout direction. Can be null.
Docs.summary: Return the layout direction for a given Locale
Docs.returns:
the layout direction. This may be one of: android.view.View#LAYOUT_DIRECTION_LTR or android.view.View#LAYOUT_DIRECTION_RTL.
Be careful: this code will need to be updated when vertical scripts will be supported

MemberSignature.Value: public static string? Join (Java.Lang.ICharSequence delimiter, Java.Lang.IIterable tokens);
.method public static hidebysig string Join(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence delimiter, class Java.Lang.IIterable tokens) cil managed
static member Join : Java.Lang.ICharSequence * Java.Lang.IIterable -> string

Docs.param: a CharSequence that will be inserted between the tokens. If null, the string "null" will be used as the delimiter.

an array objects to be joined. Strings will be formed from the objects by calling object.toString(). If tokens is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. If tokens is empty, an empty string will be returned.
Docs.summary: Returns a string containing the tokens joined by delimiters.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: a CharSequence that will be inserted between the tokens. If null, the string "null" will be used as the delimiter.

an array objects to be joined. Strings will be formed from the objects by calling object.toString(). If tokens is null, a NullPointerException will be thrown. If tokens is an empty array, an empty string will be returned.
Docs.summary: Returns a string containing the tokens joined by delimiters.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string MakeSafeForPresentation (string unclean, int maxCharactersToConsider, float ellipsizeDip, Android.Text.SafeStringFlagMode flags);
.method public static hidebysig string MakeSafeForPresentation(string unclean, int32 maxCharactersToConsider, float32 ellipsizeDip, valuetype Android.Text.SafeStringFlagMode flags) cil managed
static member MakeSafeForPresentation : string * int * single * Android.Text.SafeStringFlagMode -> string

Docs.param: The maximum number of characters of unclean to consider from the input string. 0 disables this feature.

Assuming maximum length of the string (in dip), assuming font size 42. This is roughly 50 characters for ellipsizeDip == 1000.
Usually ellipsizing should be left to the view showing the string. If a string is used as an input to another string, it might be useful to control the length of the input string though. 0 disables this feature.
Flags controlling cleaning behavior (Can be #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_TRIM, #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_SINGLE_LINE, and #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_FIRST_LINE)
Docs.summary: Remove html, remove bad characters, and truncate string.

format.a: Java documentation for android.text.TextUtils.makeSafeForPresentation(java.lang.String, int, float, int).

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public static hidebysig class Java.Lang.ICharSequence MakeSafeForPresentationFormatted(string unclean, int32 maxCharactersToConsider, float32 ellipsizeDip, valuetype Android.Text.SafeStringFlagMode flags) cil managed
static member MakeSafeForPresentationFormatted : string * int * single * Android.Text.SafeStringFlagMode -> Java.Lang.ICharSequence

Docs.param: The maximum number of characters of unclean to consider from the input string. 0 disables this feature.

Assuming maximum length of the string (in dip), assuming font size 42. This is roughly 50 characters for ellipsizeDip == 1000.
Usually ellipsizing should be left to the view showing the string. If a string is used as an input to another string, it might be useful to control the length of the input string though. 0 disables this feature.
Flags controlling cleaning behavior (Can be #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_TRIM, #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_SINGLE_LINE, and #SAFE_STRING_FLAG_FIRST_LINE)
Docs.summary: Remove html, remove bad characters, and truncate string.

format.a: Java documentation for android.text.TextUtils.makeSafeForPresentation(java.lang.String, int, float, int).

MemberSignature.Value: public static string[]? Split (string? text, string? expression);
.method public static hidebysig string[] Split(string text, string expression) cil managed
static member Split : string * string -> string[]

Docs.summary: This method yields the same result as text.split(expression, -1) except that if text.isEmpty() then this method returns an empty array whereas "".split(expression, -1) would have returned an array with a single "".
Docs.returns: an array of strings. The array will be empty if text is empty
